head.title: selector-list-comma-newline-after
head.description:
selector-list-comma-newline-after

Require a newline or disallow whitespace after the commas of selector lists.

End-of-line comments are…

body:
#selector-list-comma-newline-after

Require a newline or disallow whitespace after the commas of selector lists.

   a,
   b↑{ color: pink; }
/** ↑
 * The newline after this comma */

End-of-line comments are allowed one space after the comma.

a, /* comment */
b { color: pink; }

#Options

string: "always"|"always-multi-line"|"never-multi-line"

#"always"

There must always be a newline after the commas.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

a, b { color: pink; }
a
, b { color: pink; }

The following patterns are not considered warnings:

a,
b { color: pink; }
a
,
b { color: pink; }

#"always-multi-line"

There must always be a newline after the commas in multi-line selector lists.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

a
, b { color: pink; }

The following patterns are not considered warnings:

a, b { color: pink; }
a,
b { color: pink; }
a
,
b { color: pink; }

#"never-multi-line"

There must never be whitespace after the commas in multi-line selector lists.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

a
, b { color: pink; }
a,
b { color: pink; }

The following patterns are not considered warnings:

a,b { color: pink; }
a
,b { color: pink; }
rawBody:
# selector-list-comma-newline-after

Require a newline or disallow whitespace after the commas of selector lists.

```css
   a,
   b↑{ color: pink; }
/** ↑
 * The newline after this comma */
```

End-of-line comments are allowed one space after the comma.

```css
a, /* comment */
b { color: pink; }
```

## Options

`string`: `"always"|"always-multi-line"|"never-multi-line"`

### `"always"`

There *must always* be a newline after the commas.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
a, b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
, b { color: pink; }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a,
b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
,
b { color: pink; }
```

### `"always-multi-line"`

There *must always* be a newline after the commas in multi-line selector lists.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
a
, b { color: pink; }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a, b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a,
b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
,
b { color: pink; }
```

### `"never-multi-line"`

There *must never* be whitespace after the commas in multi-line selector lists.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
a
, b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a,
b { color: pink; }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a,b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
,b { color: pink; }
```
raw:
---
title: selector-list-comma-newline-after
---

# selector-list-comma-newline-after

Require a newline or disallow whitespace after the commas of selector lists.

```css
   a,
   b↑{ color: pink; }
/** ↑
 * The newline after this comma */
```

End-of-line comments are allowed one space after the comma.

```css
a, /* comment */
b { color: pink; }
```

## Options

`string`: `"always"|"always-multi-line"|"never-multi-line"`

### `"always"`

There *must always* be a newline after the commas.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
a, b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
, b { color: pink; }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a,
b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
,
b { color: pink; }
```

### `"always-multi-line"`

There *must always* be a newline after the commas in multi-line selector lists.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
a
, b { color: pink; }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a, b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a,
b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
,
b { color: pink; }
```

### `"never-multi-line"`

There *must never* be whitespace after the commas in multi-line selector lists.

The following patterns are considered warnings:

```css
a
, b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a,
b { color: pink; }
```

The following patterns are *not* considered warnings:

```css
a,b { color: pink; }
```

```css
a
,b { color: pink; }
```
